data.name: Alakazam
data.flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

data.name: Dark Blastoise
data.flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

data.name: Dark Dragonite
data.flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

data.name: Dark Persian
data.flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

data.name: Dark Raichu
data.flavorText: Stores up electricity in its body, then suddenly releases it to surprise and shock everyone.

data.name: Dark Slowbro
data.flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

data.name: Dark Vaporeon
data.flavorText: A Pokémon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon like to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

data.name: Venusaur
data.flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

data.name: Golem
data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

data.name: Kabutops
data.flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

data.name: Pidgeot
data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

data.name: Dark Dragonair
data.flavorText: As is fitting for a legendary Pokémon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.

data.name: Dark Wartortle
data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.

data.name: Dewgong
data.flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

data.name: Fearow
data.flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

data.name: Ivysaur
data.flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

data.name: Kabuto
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

data.name: Kadabra
data.flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

data.name: Omastar
data.flavorText: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hope of racing it.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

data.name: Abra
data.flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while others believe it is formed from smog.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: It's said that not even pro wrestlers can take down a Machop.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: Normally friendly, it quickly becomes angry if it doesn't get what it wants.

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

data.name: Sandshrew
data.flavorText: Burrow deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

data.name: Spearow
data.flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.
